words.definition: To constrain something or someone is to limit its development or force it to behave in a particular way.
words.example: The country's progress was constrained by its lack of natural resources.

words.definition: A depot is a place where buses or trains stop, or where goods are stored.
words.example: The bus pulled into the depot to let the passengers off.

words.definition: To emulate someone means to try to be like them because you admire them.
words.example: He tried to emulate his older brother's success in business.

words.definition: The forefinger is the finger next to the thumb.
words.example: He pointed his forefinger at the map to show where they were.

words.definition: Guts is the courage or determination needed to do something difficult.
words.example: It takes a lot of guts to stand up for what you believe in.

words.definition: An inherent quality is a natural part of something and cannot be separated from it.
words.example: There are inherent risks in any kind of investment.

words.definition: To intimidate someone means to make them feel afraid or nervous.
words.example: The big dog intimidated the children with its loud bark.

words.definition: A janitor is a person whose job is to take care of a large building, such as a school.
words.example: The janitor cleaned the hallways every evening.

words.definition: If something is moist, it is slightly wet.
words.example: The cake was delicious and moist.

words.definition: Nope is an informal way of saying no.
words.example: When I asked if he was ready, he just said, 'Nope.'

words.definition: To prod someone means to push them with a finger or a pointed object.
words.example: She prodded him in the back to get his attention.

words.definition: A ransom is a sum of money that is paid to free a person who is being held captive.
words.example: The kidnappers demanded a large ransom for the return of the businessman.

words.definition: To restrain someone or something means to prevent them from moving or doing something.
words.example: The police had to restrain the angry crowd.

words.definition: Saliva is the liquid that is produced in your mouth.
words.example: The smell of food caused saliva to fill his mouth.

words.definition: To spit means to force liquid or food out of your mouth.
words.example: He spit the sour grape out of his mouth.

words.definition: To sprint means to run very fast for a short distance.
words.example: He had to sprint to catch the bus before it left.

words.definition: A stunt is a dangerous or difficult action that is done to entertain people.
words.example: The movie featured many amazing car stunts.

words.definition: If you are tolerant, you are willing to accept things that you do not agree with.
words.example: She is very tolerant of other people's opinions.

words.definition: A vampire is a mythical creature that drinks the blood of living people.
words.example: In the movie, the vampire only came out at night.

words.definition: To yawn means to open your mouth wide and breathe in deeply because you are tired or bored.
words.example: He couldn't help but yawn during the long meeting.
